info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 7:24PM CDT until July 21 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Des Moines IA
info.description:
FFWDMX
The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Polk County in central Iowa... Northwestern Warren County in south central Iowa...
* Until 130 AM CDT Monday.
* At 724 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Des Moines, West Des Moines, Urbandale, Clive, Norwalk, Windsor Heights, Des Moines Int'l Airport, Drake Stadium And Knapp Center, Valley West Mall, Principal Park, Iowa Events Center, Southridge Mall, Cumming and Walnut Woods State Park.
Several streets in Des Moines metro are flooded with water up to bumpers.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
For the latest waterway observations and forecasts refer to weather.gov/desmoines/water.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
